newsitem.title: ITALY: ALPINE SKIING-TOMBA FINED OVER NUDE PHOTO ROW.
newsitem.headline: ALPINE SKIING-TOMBA FINED OVER NUDE PHOTO ROW.

text.p: A court told Alberto Tomba to pay around $6,000 on Thursday for an incident in 1995 when he threw a glass trophy at a freelance photographer who had taken nude pictures of the Alpine skiing star.
The judge in the northern city of Bolzano gave Tomba a sentence under a plea bargain of two months and 20 days in prison, converted into a six million lire fine plus four million lire in legal costs.
Italian photographer Aldo Martinuzzi is also suing the former Olympic and world champion for civil damages in a separate court case that has yet to be heard.

Tomba lobbed a magnum of sparkling wine, which missed Martinuzzi, and a heavy glass trophy at the photographer in December 1995 from the podium in the resort of Alta Badia after finishing third in a World Cup slalom.
Martinuzzi said at the time that he had taken pictures of Tomba naked in a Swiss sauna before the 1988 Calgary Olympics, apparently with the skier's consent.
They were published in an Italian magazine in 1995.
He suffered minor cuts to his hand and said that Tomba had thrown the trophy at him deliberately.
Tomba was a sergeant in the Carabinieri paramilitary police force at the time of the incident which occurred just days before his 29th birthday. He has since left the force.
